Quarto ha hecho que me vuelva a interesar por Phyton!!!

Es muy fácil combinar chunks de R con Py, solo hay que pasar los datos así: `my_py_data = r.df`




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
df <- gapminder::gapminder
iris <- iris
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
from siuba import _, group_by, summarize

my_data = r.df

(my_data
  >> group_by(_.continent)
  >> summarize(avg_lifeExp = _.lifeExp.mean())
  )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  continent  avg_lifeExp
0    Africa    48.865330
1  Americas    64.658737
2      Asia    60.064903
3    Europe    71.903686
4   Oceania    74.326208
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
from siuba import mutate, _
from plotnine import ggplot, aes, geom_point

my_data = r.iris

(my_data
  >> ggplot(aes("Sepal.Length", "Petal.Length", color = "Species"))
   + geom_point()
)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
<ggplot: (8731619700508)>
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](post_08_phyton_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=614}
:::
:::
